titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Richard H. Wilson papers, 1898-1935

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Ann Mulfort March 2013

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

bioghist.head: Biography of Richard H. Wilson
bioghist.p: Richard H. Wilson (d. 1937) was an army officer who served with the U.S. Eighth Infantry. He was probably stationed at Fort McKinney, Wyoming, before it closed in 1894. In 1895, he was posted to the Wind River Indian Reservation in Wyoming, where he served as Indian agent. In 1898, with the outbreak of the Spanish-American War, he was recalled to regular army service and saw action in Cuba.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection includes handwritten and typed drafts of Wilson's reminiscences of the Spanish-American War; a handwritten manuscript regarding a military operation from Fort McKinney, "History of the Salt Creek Expedition of 1894"; three hand drawn maps (1898, 1935) related to the Battle of El Caney; and miscellaneous materials related to his Spanish-American War service.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by Richard H. Wilson at the date of processing.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
